snippet: The detention of the two Egyptian youths, ages 9 and 10, is part of a spate of recent cases involving accusations that people have insulted Islam.
abstract: Two Coptic Christian boys are detained by Egyptian authorities on charges that they defiled pages of a Koran, in latest case involving accusations of insults to Islam; charges may add to growing anxieties in Egypt about free speech rights and the status of nation's Christian minority, which fears an erosion of rights under an Islamist government.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAI AYYAD

lead_paragraph: The detention of the two Egyptian youths, ages 9 and 10, is part of a spate of recent cases involving accusations that people have insulted Islam.

headline.main: Egypt: 2 Coptic Boys Are Held as Contempt-of-Religion Cases Rise
headline.print_headline: Egypt: 2 Coptic Boys Are Held As Contempt of Religion Cases Rise

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
